etymology.description: 大 ‘big; great’ + 陆 ‘land; continent’ = ‘mainland (great landmass)’
etymology.interpretation: Literally “great land,” denoting the large continuous landmass in contrast with seas and islands. In modern contexts it often abbreviates 中国大陆, i.e., Mainland China.
etymology.simplification: 陸 was simplified to 陆 by reducing the right component’s strokes (from 坴 to a 击-like form) while keeping the阝 radical, following stroke-reduction patterns for 阜-radical characters.

parts.english: land; continent; dry land; to land

examples.chinese: 我们从台湾飞往大陆(我們從臺灣飛往大陸)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen cóng Táiwān fēi wǎng Dàlù.
examples.english: We are flying from Taiwan to the mainland.

examples.chinese: 他在大陆工作多年(他在大陸工作多年)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài Dàlù gōngzuò duō nián.
examples.english: He has worked on the mainland for many years.

examples.chinese: 中国大陆与香港之间往来频繁(中國大陸與香港之間往來頻繁)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó Dàlù yǔ Xiānggǎng zhījiān wǎnglái pínfán.
examples.english: There is frequent travel between Mainland China and Hong Kong.
